Introduction

Sunho, formerly known as Seonghun, and Howoo, is a South Korean rapper and singer under VT Entertainment. He is currently a member of the pre-debut boy group TRY=1.

Sunho made his first debut on June 17, 2018, as a member of the group Like A Movie (now known as APEX) under Top Cloud Entertainment. He left the group in December of the same year for unknown reasons. He then, in the same month, joined the group CHAZE under the same agency, which disbanded in May 2020.

In June 2020, he was announced as a member of the boy group ONE A DAY which has been inactive since 2020, meaning they probably have silently disbanded.

On March 1, 2021, Sunho was revealed as a member of DUSTIN under Na Entertainment, which he probably left when they disbanded on May 24, 2021, as he wasn’t a part of the group when they reformed in December of the same year.

He was revealed as a member of the upcoming boy group Be on new under Be the max Entertainment on September 6, 2022. Sadly, the group never debuted as almost all of the members, including Sunho, left the company in December 2022.

On January 2, 2023, he was announced as a member of the pre-debut boy group (M)IRROR, under VT Entertainment. The group debuted on May 12, 2023, but presumably disbanded a few months later.

Sunho was then revealed as a member of the upcoming boy group TRY1 on March 2, 2024. The debut date of the group is currently unknown but they are set to do pre-debut activities in Japan this year.
